nodes.text: I hate to break the news to you, but this is the last class in Science 102: Practical Applications of Basic Scientific Principles.
I hope that you all have a renewed interest in the Sciences and now know the joy of experimentation. May you always question assumptions and put them to the test.
This session will be devoted to allow you to pursue the experiments of your choice.
However, one of you failed to demonstrate that he truly appreciates the marvels and nuances of Science.
Mr. O'Conner, you answered several questions incorrectly in yesterday's final exam. This leads me to theorize the following premises...
Hypothesis 1 - You have insufficient appreciation of Science and did not study for the exam.
Hypothesis 2 - You were too eager to get to the laboratory to properly analyze the questions before you put down an answer.
So tell me, young man, which of my hypotheses comes the closest to describing the actual reasons you failed the exam?
I'm sorry sir. I guess I didn't pay enough attention to the test because of the lure of experimentation and the chance to do actual Science.
I can certainly understand your enthusiasm for experimentation.
Never let it be said that I denied someone his last opportunity to experience experimentation. You may participate in today's laboratory session.
Thank you, sir. I will make the most of my lab time to properly experiment.
I'm sorry that your enthusiasm for experimentation overrode your diligence on the test. However, a diligent discipline for accuracy is critical for Scientists.
You'll have to leave now.
I have a great deal of respect for you and for the essence of Science, so Hypothesis 1 is completely false.
I took this class for the opportunity to experiment and learn more about the principles of Thermo-dynamics and Chemistry. There is nothing quite like the smell of naphtha burning in the afternoon.
If I did poorly on the test, Sir, it was purely because of my interest in doing Science.
Never let it be said that I denied someone his last opportunity to experience experimentation. You may participate in today's laboratory session.
Thank you, sir. I will make the most of my lab time to properly experiment.
I'm sorry that your enthusiasm for experimentation overrode your diligence on the test. However, a diligent discipline for accuracy is critical for Scientists.
You'll have to leave now.
Sir, I believe that some of the questions on the test were patently unfair.
The answers were vague, poorly phrased, and did not directly address the implied question. In fact, most of the problems were not phrased in the form of a question.
Since there was no one for one straightforward answer to most of the questions, the test goes directly against the Scientific principles upon which this class is based.

So, to refute your Hypothesis as to why I did poorly on the test, I conclude that neither one of them describes the actual reason. The correct answer is that the test was an invalid measure of Scientific knowledge.
Hmmm... you make some interesting points there, Shawn.
Never let it be said that I denied someone his last opportunity to experience experimentation. You may participate in today's laboratory session.
You sound like those imbeciles on Science Island who rejected my Unified Field Theory of Magic and Science! "Invalid measure of Scientific knowledge, indeed!
You'll have to leave now.
No answer? Well, I guess that explains how seriously you take this class.
You'll have to leave now.
You all did very well on the Final Exam. Perhaps not as well as you did on the previous exam, but you did all pass.
And now, we're gonna have to Science the shit out of this place!
